üèÜ Advanced Phase: Enterprise

Weeks 9-14 | Administration, Governance, AI & Performance

Phase Overview

You‚Äôve mastered GitHub features and automation. Now it‚Äôs time for enterprise-scale concerns: administration, APIs, integrations, compliance, measuring success, and AI-powered development with Copilot.

What You‚Äôll Learn

By the end of this phase, you‚Äôll understand: - Enterprise GitHub administration - GitHub APIs (REST and GraphQL) - Webhooks, GitHub Apps, and OAuth - Infrastructure as Code with GitHub - Audit logging and compliance - DORA metrics implementation - Organization insights and analytics - GitHub Copilot fundamentals and advanced features - AI-powered development workflows

Phase Context

Before: You can build complete CI/CD pipelines with security scanning and deployment automation.

After: You‚Äôll advise enterprise customers on organization design, API integrations, compliance requirements, and DevOps performance measurement.

Modules

üìò Module 9: Enterprise Administration & Integration

Duration: 10-12 hours | Week: 9

Master enterprise GitHub administration and organization management.

Topics: - GitHub Enterprise Cloud vs Server - Organization structure and team management - Authentication (SAML, SSO, EMU) - Enterprise policies and settings - Repository rulesets at scale - Engineering Systems Success Playbook - Organization insights and reporting

Learning Outcomes: - Design organization structures for enterprise customers - Configure SSO and authentication - Set enterprise-wide policies - Apply Engineering Systems best practices

Start Module 9 ‚Üí

üìò Module 10: GitHub APIs, Webhooks & GitHub Apps

Duration: 12-14 hours | Week: 10

Build custom integrations using GitHub‚Äôs APIs and app platform.

Topics: - REST API fundamentals and best practices - GraphQL API for complex queries - Authentication (PATs, OAuth, GitHub Apps) - Rate limiting and pagination - Webhooks for event-driven automation - GitHub Apps architecture and permissions - OAuth Apps vs GitHub Apps - Marketplace requirements

Learning Outcomes: - Make authenticated API calls (REST and GraphQL) - Handle rate limiting and errors - Create webhooks for event-driven workflows - Build a basic GitHub App - Choose the right authentication method

Start Module 10 ‚Üí

üìò Module 11: Infrastructure as Code & Operations

Duration: 10-12 hours | Week: 10-11

Manage infrastructure as code and implement operational best practices.

Topics: - Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles - Terraform/Bicep with GitHub Actions - GitOps workflows - Monitoring and observability - Incident response with GitHub Issues - Documentation best practices - Community health files - Notification management

Learning Outcomes: - Deploy infrastructure using IaC pipelines - Implement GitOps patterns - Set up incident response workflows - Build comprehensive documentation sites

Start Module 11 ‚Üí

üìò Module 12: Governance, Compliance & DORA Metrics

Duration: 12-14 hours | Week: 12

Master compliance, audit, security governance, and DevOps performance measurement.

Topics: - Enterprise security governance - Audit log streaming and SIEM integration - Compliance requirements (SOC2, HIPAA, FedRAMP) - Enterprise Managed Users (EMU) - IP allow lists and network security - Security policies at scale - DORA metrics implementation - Organization insights and analytics - Custom reporting with APIs

Learning Outcomes: - Configure audit log streaming - Design security governance frameworks - Implement complete DORA metrics collection - Build metrics dashboards - Assess DevOps maturity

Start Module 12 ‚Üí

üìò Module 13: GitHub Copilot Fundamentals

Duration: 8-10 hours | Week: 13

Master AI-powered development with GitHub Copilot basics.

Topics: - Copilot architecture and capabilities - IDE setup (VS Code, JetBrains, Neovim, CLI) - Prompt crafting techniques - Code completions best practices - Copilot Chat usage - Context management and optimization

Learning Outcomes: - Configure Copilot across different IDEs - Write effective prompts for better suggestions - Use Copilot Chat for explanations and code generation - Apply best practices for developer productivity

Start Module 13 ‚Üí

üìò Module 14: GitHub Copilot Advanced

Duration: 10-12 hours | Week: 14

Extend Copilot with agents, MCP, extensions, and enterprise administration.

Topics: - Copilot Agents (@workspace, Coding Agent, Edits) - Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers - Building Copilot Extensions - Custom instructions and knowledge bases - Enterprise Copilot administration - Metrics, analytics, and adoption strategies

Learning Outcomes: - Use Copilot Agents for complex, multi-file tasks - Create and configure MCP servers - Build custom Copilot Extensions - Manage Copilot at enterprise scale - Measure and drive Copilot adoption

Start Module 14 ‚Üí

Advanced Phase Milestone Project

üéØ Project: Enterprise GitHub Assessment & Implementation Plan

Objective: Conduct a comprehensive assessment of an enterprise organization and deliver recommendations with implementation roadmap.

Requirements:

Part 1: Organization Design (20%)

  1. Design enterprise organization structure
  2. Map teams to repositories
  3. Define authentication strategy (SAML/EMU)
  4. Create policy framework (Actions, security, access)

Part 2: API Integration (20%)

  1. Build a GitHub App or integration
  2. Implement webhook handling
  3. Create custom reporting dashboard
  4. Document API usage and rate limit management

Part 3: Security & Compliance (25%)

  1. Conduct organization-wide security audit
  2. Configure audit log streaming
  3. Create security governance policies
  4. Develop compliance checklist for your industry

Part 4: DORA Metrics Implementation (25%)

  1. Implement all four DORA metrics:
    • Deployment Frequency
    • Lead Time for Changes
    • Mean Time to Recovery
    • Change Failure Rate
  2. Build metrics dashboard
  3. Benchmark against DORA research
  4. Create improvement recommendations

Part 5: Presentation (10%)

  1. Executive summary for leadership
  2. Technical deep-dive for engineers
  3. Implementation roadmap with timeline
  4. ROI analysis

Deliverables: - Enterprise organization design document - Working GitHub App or integration - Security assessment and policies - DORA metrics dashboard - 30-minute presentation (executive + technical)

Assessment Criteria: - Organization design and best practices (20%) - API integration functionality (20%) - Security and compliance thoroughness (25%) - DORA metrics accuracy and insights (25%) - Presentation quality and recommendations (10%)

Phase Completion Checklist

Before completing the training program, ensure you can:

  • Design enterprise-scale organization structures
  • Configure SSO, SAML, and EMU
  • Build custom integrations using GitHub APIs
  • Create webhooks and GitHub Apps
  • Implement Infrastructure as Code pipelines
  • Configure audit log streaming and monitoring
  • Create security governance frameworks
  • Implement complete DORA metrics collection
  • Build custom reporting dashboards
  • Assess customer DevOps maturity
  • Deliver executive and technical presentations
  • Complete the Advanced Phase Milestone Project

  3. ‚úÖ GitHub Advanced Security - Prove security capabilities
